sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The international community condemns Russia's widespread missile attacks across Ukraine as both sides exchange mutual blame for the latest escalation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Protesters across European capitals voice their anger towards Russia as it renews widespread missile attacks across Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Anti-government protesters continue to defy authorities in Iran despite a harsh crackdown as oil refinery workers join the movement by going on strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine was on high alert on Monday night following Russia's earlier unleashing of its most widespread missile bombardment in months. The onslaught appears to have taken the war to a new level. Monday's strikes killed at least 14 and injured dozens more, international condemnations being swift.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A planned special session of the UN General Assembly took on an added urgency, with both sides trading accusations of terrorism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: By launching missile attacks on civilians, sleeping in their homes, or rushing to work, children going to schools, Russia has proven once again that it is a terrorist state that must be deterred in the strongest possible ways. Moscow says it's retaliating for the bombing of a crucial bridge linking occupied Crimea to the Russian mainland. It blames Ukraine. The evidence of what the Kyiv regime can do is the sabotage of the Crimea bridge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We warned that this will not be conducted with impunity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: When you do these acts of sabotage, when you kill those who are unfavourable to you, the Kyiv regime is on the same level with the most outrageous terrorist organizations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Hardliners in Moscow are pushing for more, including Putin ally Dmitry Medvedev, who tweeted, the first episode has been played.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There will be others to dismantle Ukraine's political regime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's president remains defiant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukraine cannot be intimidated. Only united even more, Ukraine cannot be stopped.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Only convinced even more that terrorists must be neutralized.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Zelensky went on to promise Ukrainians that everything that was destroyed will be rebuilt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: will be rebuilt.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At least 15 explosions have hit the Ukrainian city of Zaporizhia during the night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: That's according to a tweet from the Ukrainian deputy foreign minister, Emin Dezepa. She says that at least one person has been killed, and a school, a medical institute and residential buildings were struck.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The city has been one of the most heavily targeted in Russia's latest wave of missile attacks that started on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Across the country, dozens were reported killed or injured after civilian areas, including apartment blocks, were hit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There have been numerous protests in European capitals against Russia's attacks on Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Bucharest, dozens of expats gathered outside the Ukrainian embassy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Diplomatic staff, including Ukraine's ambassador to Romania, expressed frustration with Moscow's apparent refusal to consider a political solution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In Prague, hundreds turned out to condemn the Russian strikes against multiple cities across Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The demonstrators at central Wenceslas Square held up crosses with the names of places hit by Russian missiles, as well as umbrellas symbolising air defences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, protesters staged a fake referendum to vote to annex the Russian enclave of Kaliningrad in front of the Russian embassy in a satire on Russia's annexation of four Ukrainian territories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And in Rome, about 100 Ukrainians gathered in a location not far from the Russian embassy, shouting slogans criticizing Russian President Vladimir Putin Moscow has justified its actions saying it's fighting terrorism since the start of the war in Ukraine independent and free Russian news outlets have struggled to

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: provide information to millions of Russians not interested in state media many journalists have had to leave Russia finding exile in Latvia, where they've been allowed to continue their work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And they're finding ways to get news to those left behind, despite Moscow's attempts to block what it calls dissident news websites.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: You can't be journalist if government say you don't look there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Just pretend that there is no war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: So I think that the only way how journalism is still exist in the country is this this outlets left country and work from abroad with some networks of shadow reporters people who work at a very risky situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The stakes are high for independent journalists in Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They can face up to 15 years in prison for calling Russia's activities in Ukraine a war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Journalists who had to leave hold Russian state media responsible for the country's current situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I think that these people from Russian TV stations, they are war criminals because they were waging this war and they were encouraging people to be killed because they were encouraging them to go as volunteers into Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So I think that these people should be prosecuted for it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Around 300 Russian opposition journalists have moved to Latvia since February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Riga has also banned all Russian-based TV channels and describes these as propaganda, warmongering and a threat to national security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Today the UK Supreme Court will hear arguments on whether Holyrood can set up a second referendum on Scottish independence without the consent of Westminster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The hearing will take two days, but the results aren't expected before weeks, maybe even months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But this court's ruling could pave the way for voters across Scotland to once again choose on whether Scotland should remain part of the UK or not.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Nicola Sturgeon, the country's First Minister, received a standing ovation as she made another push for Scottish independence at her party conference in Aberdeen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: ar gyfer cyd-diddordeb yng Nghymru ar gynharachol y partid yn Aberdeen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Mae cyd-diddordeb yn bwysig.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Mae'n bwysig ysgogi rheoli a chyflawni Westminster.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Mae'n bwysig cael y llywodraethau yr ydym yn eu cymryd i gyd-diddordeb i gynnal cymorth i'n GIG, i adeiladu partner newydd o gyfraith gyda'r ddynion eraill ar y dynion hyn. to properly protect our NHS, to build a new partnership of equals with the other nations on these islands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It is essential if we want to be back in the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Scottish independence movement gained traction again when the UK voted to leave the EU, despite Scotland voting to stay in the bloc.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The latest opinion polls suggest that people in Scotland are now evenly split on the subject of independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Bank of England is extending its emergency intervention, warning a sell-off of government bonds was a material risk to financial stability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: With the sterling and bonds both falling hard in recent days, it's the second time the bank has been forced to step in, buying a wider range of bonds to help restore conditions. The sterling yesterday slid to a 10-day low and today has fallen again to 0.31% this morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Now new figures from the Institute for Fiscal Studies show Kwasi Kwarteng will need to find £60 billion of savings by 2026 to fill the gap left by unfunded tax cuts and the costs of extra borrowing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But it's not the only challenge we face.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Liz Truss last week gave her first speech as leader to the Conservative Party, where she defended her economic policies and the Chancellor's plans.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Chancellor and the Governor will keep closely coordinating our monetary and fiscal policy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the Chancellor and I are in complete lockstep on this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The UK's sluggish growth rate, thanks to a toxic cocktail of a slowing global economy, the UK's weakened trade balance after Brexit and the fallout from the mini-budget, means the UK growth rate is now forecast to be less than half than initially predicted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: rate is now forecast to be less than half than initially predicted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Students chant slogans as they protest at Tehran's Amikabir University of Technology. They are continuing to defy the authorities despite a crackdown, which activists say has left dozens dead and hundreds more imprisoned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The unrest erupted over three weeks ago over the death of Masa Amini, a 22-year-old Iranian woman of Kurdish origin who died following her arrest by the morality police in Tehran for allegedly failing to observe the Islamic Republic's strict dress code for women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: While students have led the protests, social media is now showing workers at two oil refineries have joined in by holding strikes. A combination of mass protests and strikes by oil workers and shopkeepers helped sweep the clergy to power in the Iranian revolution four decades ago.
